page.title: 01Leven:Landward Area.
page.content: The study area consists of very fertile land which is intensely cultivated. The land is undulating and slopes from the North-west to South-east.The highest point being 185m the lowest being sea level.There are no rivers but the area is drained by several small streams which flow into the Firth of Forth. There are ten farms. But there are no villages or towns but the town of Leven is nearby.The area is well served by roads which radiate from Leven.There are no railway lines now although there is evidence of one which used to be a goods line between Kennoway and Largoward. The climate experienced in the area assists the farmers.The number of frost free days is below average for the British Isles.Rainfall,too,is low.
